meanings.definition: To boil (something) before cooking or further preparation.
meanings.sent1: Before making soup, it is important to preboil the vegetables to soften them.
meanings.sent2: I always preboil the pasta before adding it to the sauce.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally preboiled the eggs twice, making them extra firm!
meanings.sent4: Her excitement preboiled inside her like a pot of water waiting to bubble over.
meanings.sent5: The water in the pot began to preboil, creating tiny bubbles at the bottom.

meanings.definition: The act of boiling something before cooking or further preparation.
meanings.sent1: Preboiling is a common technique used in many recipes to speed up cooking time.
meanings.sent2: The preboiling of the meat helped remove excess fat before grilling.
meanings.sent3: The preboiling of the vegetables made them look like they were dancing in the pot!
meanings.sent4: The anticipation in the room was like the preboiling of water before a big event.
meanings.sent5: The chef demonstrated the importance of preboiling by showing the difference in texture.
